alert.note: Alert for Brown (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 04 at 7:22PM CDT until August 05 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL ROCK AND EASTERN BROWN COUNTIES... At 722 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles southeast of Long Pine, or 13 miles south of Bassett, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Sybrant, Twin Lakes State Wildlife Management Area and Pony Lake. This includes Highway 183 between mile markers 156 and 177. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
